pageContent: Aim: Research suggests that anxiety may be a common response to a cancer diagnosis, but research is needed to examine anxiety before diagnosis. Anxiety before diagnosis may relate to the comprehension of relevant health information or openness to potential treatments. This study examined anxiety and these outcomes in men who were waiting to learn of a prostate cancer diagnosis.

metaData.source:
Long-term outcome of detectable PSA levels after radical prostatectomy
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/15711604/
